Assessment of Mobile Phone Safety

We have, as an independent scientist and medical organization, investigated the facts and want to clarify the issue because, the Mobile Phone industry has been creating an impression that there are conflicting opinions about the hazards.

In reality, most of the controversy is a mirage, created through fraudulent research by corrupt scientists paid by the industry.

The major “controversy” regarding health risks appears to be between independent, honest scientists on one hand and industry-funded scientists on the other hand. The latter have been commissioned to distort or rig the data in favor of industrial interests.

When corporate-funded research is excluded, the picture becomes clear and uncontroversial, with a large majority of the results indicating important harmful effects of mobile phones (and related devices including cordless phones and WiFi).

The damaging effect of  their radiation becomes especially obvious when one applies a multidisciplinary, systemic (holistic) approach, considering the issue from all angles and perspectives that are relevant to safety assessment.

A diametrically opposite, very narrow, approach for radiation risk assessment has been applied by World Health Organization (WHO), the European Union and other bodies. It relies heavily on epidemiological studies (investigating if brain tumors etc are more common among mobile phone users). This is not scientifically justifiable because epidemiology has important weaknesses that makes it too unreliable to serve as the main basis for risk assessment. The reason why this unsuitable approach has been dominating, is probably that mobile technology proponents and lobbyists have had an undue influence on the evaluation procedure,  see footnote.

Our assessment of the health effects in brief

It is proven beyond reasonable doubt that mobile phones can affect health, but it is not clear yet to what extent.

  • An increased risk for brain tumors definitely exists, but in terms of numbers, few people are at risk, because brain tumors are rare.  

More about this

  • However, there are other harmful effects,  especially on the brain, which may affect the psychology and physiology of many people – more data are needed to investigate the extent and degree of influence, but available evidence indicate that a large percentage of users may be affected. 

More about this

  • The risk for DNA-damage is well confirmed, causing an increased risk for infertility and fetal damage in addition to an increased risk for cancers (not only brain tumors), according to recent reports. 

More about this

  • The damaging effect is mediated by chemically aggressive free radicals, elicited by the radiation. 

More about this

Free-radical-quenching substances, so-called Anti-oxidants are likely to have a significant protective effect against the damaging effects of this radiation.

Also, people were included in the study who had been using mobile phones far to short time to develop brain tumors (it takes 10 years at least), for more   see  “Mobile Cancer Risk Study Inconclusive“.

The many possibilities of distorting epidemiological studies in favor of “desirable outcome”  is probably the reason why some covertly industry-connected experts in advisory commitees have systematically neglected or downplayed other research of great importance. This goes especilly for a professor and owner of a mobile phone lobbying company who was the president of the key WHO committee for assessing radiation hazards and establishing safety norms. He exerted a decisive influence on the assessment procedure until he was shamefully dismissed in 2011 when his true role as a lobbyist was revealed.

Do choose a mobile phone with low radiation level

2014/12/07 02:56 / Leave a comment

There is almost a tenfold difference between the radiation impact of the worst and best mobile phones and this might translate into a difference of life, ill health and and too early death in your case. If you doubt, read our posting “Cellphone hazards proven beyond doubt“.

The so called Specific Absorption Rate (SAR) is not a perfect indicator of the impact but good enough to give a guidance. It indicates the amount of electromagnetic energy that is absorbed measured in Watts/kg. The maximum allowed level is 1.6 Watts/kg. We already want to point out that there are reasons to lower the allowed level hundredfold or more. No existing mobile phone would fullfil such a requirement. But even so, there are good reasons to choose one of those with the lowest SAR values.

Our definite opinion, based on our interdisciplinary understanding of the important negative health impact of microwave raditation, is that the SAR value should be a major factor in the choice of a cellphone or smartphone. 

Choose only among the phones with the lowest SAR values!

Samsung has set a good example

Samsung developed an antenna that directs the radiation to a large extent away from the head. The result is that their smartphones have lower SAR values than most of the others.

It is really sad that a company with such a great technological power and over 300 millions users is ignoring or refusing to consider the health of their clients. Science-based cellphone radiation protection

2014/12/05 21:03 / Leave a comment

There are many devices on the market sold without any tenable evidence.

Fortunately there is a science-based solution that can reduce the damaging effect of cellphone radiation. To understand it, you need first to know how the damage works:

1. The nature of the harmful influence

The radiation causes formation of tissue-damaging free radicals. It can generate more free radicals in the tissues than the body can neutralize. This condition is called oxidative stress.

Oxidative stress has been linked to increased cancer, including Brain Tumor risk, Alzheimer, Parkinson and other serious chronic disorders.

It may also have a negative effect on cognitive functioning (that is thinking, reasoning, remembering).

2. How to protect yourself

Antioxidants

These substances neutralize the free radicals. Generous daily use of antioxidants reduces the harmful impact of cellphone radiation to an important extent.

We want to emphasize that generally, the officially recommended daily allowance for important antioxidant vitamins are generally far to low.

Below you find some of the most important antioxidants.

Vitamin C. It is a very effective and valuable antioxidant for the whole body including the brain. It appears to play an important role in the brain, and its concentration is 10 times greater there than in the blood. The stores of vitamin C in the brain are the last ones to be depleted, indicating that it plays a very important, not yet fully understood role.

The Recommended Daily intake (RDI) is in most countries 10-20 times too low for Vitamin C. It is non-toxic and can therefore be taken generously in gram-sized-doses, preferably in Slow-release tablets.

The requirement is dependent on the health and stress level of the person and needs to be adapted individually. For best possible protection, take the “bowel tolerance dose”. This is the dose you can take without the mild, completely harmless gastrointestinal reaction that occurs when the body gets more than it needs. Dr Sandra Goodman has written a good text about finding out the Vitamin C  dose you need. When ill, you may need tens of grams and this will have a beneficial effect.

Vitamin C was actually produced by our ancestors until about 60 million years ago, when a genetic defect occurred so that we lost the ability to produce this vitamin. All other mammals are able to produce Vitamin C except a few more mammal species. The biochemistry of other mammals is otherwise the same. So Vitamin C is a perfectly natural and necessary substance for our health, and that we may need very high doses of it when ill.

Read more about Vitamin C  here.

If you don’t take any other antioxidant, do take vitamin C for your protection, but better follow the advice below.

Selenium plays a very important role. It is required for key antioxidant enzymes as well as for DNA repair. It is a must in the parts of the world where the soils are deficient in Selenium including  parts of North and South America, parts of Central and Northern Europe including Scandinavia. Important not to take Selenium selenite or Selenium selenate, they are harmful. Take Selenium mentionate or Selenium bound to yeast or amino acids (chelates). Seaweed and Kelp are usually good sources.
Iodine is a powerful brain antioxidant. Daily intake of Seaweed and kelp is a good habit.
Vitamin E is likewise important, but not as synthetic alpha tocopherol, which is the most sold preparation in pharmacies. It is better to use the tocotrienols, especially alpha-tocotrienol according to a recent study, see “Gifted Vitamin E protects the brain against stroke..“. Red palm kernel oil is especially rich.
Antoxidant foods and spices
We go into some detail here, because there are very powerful food antioxidants, and by just improving your food habits you can increase your protection to an important extent.
Especially the colorful berries are rich in antioxidants. The Indian Amla berry is very valuable. Cranberries, blueberries, lingon berries, raspberries, blackberries, Goji berries, cherries, dark plums, dark red or violet grapes (like Concord) are all strongly antioxidant.
Among spices, Turmeric deserves special mention. It is especially rich in powerful antioxidants. Many other spices as well. Cinnamon, basil, oregano, rosemary, ginger are among the highest ranked.
Among vegetables, Artichoke Hearts are highly ranked, kale, spinach and tomatoes as well. Small red beans, Pinto beans, red kidney beans.

DNA repair

For the repair of DNA, damaged by the free radicals generated by cellphone radiation, Selenium is needed. In addition to being necessary for antioxidant enzymes, it stimulates DNA repair.

Quercetin also stimulates DNA repair. It is found in citrus fruits,  onions and all berries, especially elderberries and blueberries.

There is not yet sufficient research to establish to what extent these substances can repair the DNA. For safety it is wise to be well provided with said substances along with a high level of antioxidant protection.

Conclusion

There is ample evidence that microwave radiation generates harmful free radicals. Therefore we strongly recommend very generous use of antioxidants as well as of substances that can support the repair of the damage.

It is not clear to what extent this protection works, but no doubt, the more, the better.

For more details: see “The best natural ways to protect against radiation damage” by Dr J.S.Williams, M.D.

Cellphones increase brain cancer risk – new study confirms

2014/12/04 01:50 / 1 Comment on Cellphones increase brain cancer risk – new study confirms

But even so your chances of contracting a tumor from cellphone usage is less than one on 5000

The risk for Glioma, a malignant brain tumor, increases threefold in people who talked on cellphone or cordlessphone for over 25 years compared to those who have used wireless phone for less than one year. There was a distinct connection between the number of years and hours of use.

“The risk is three times higher after 25 years of use. We can see this clearly,” lead researcher Dr. Lennart Hardell told Reuters Health in a telephone interview.

Reuters surprisingly badly informed

Reuters notes that this result contrasts with the International Interphone Study, that Reuters said “failed to find strong evidence that mobile phones increased the risk of brain tumors.” Evidently Reuters is surprisingly badly informed. As we have pointed out, the International Interphone Study from 2010 had important weaknesses to the extent that it did not fulfill the qualifications for a conclusive study. About that study we concluded:

“..[The International Interphone Study] is fraudulent science

These flaws are so numerous, serious and elementary that it seems extremely unlikely that they have occurred by accident. In plain language, this is most likely the case of fraudulent research.

For details, see The famous Interphone Study is seriously flawed. These flaws are of the same nature as those found in other industry-sponsored studies, see Research misconduct behind industry-sponsored studies?“

The brain tumor will remain rare

As also PSRAST has pointed out in this blog (see Mobile Phones will not cause an epidemic of brain tumors), the risk for developing a glioma would still be low because the risk for any kind of brain cancer is very low – about 0,005%. So a tripling would yield about 0,015% contracting brain cancer. And this goes only for those who have been using the cellphone daily for 25 years.

Excerpt from Reuters:

Professor Hardell, at the University Hospital in Orebro, Sweden, and his colleague Michael Carlberg matched 1,380 patients with malignant brain tumors to people without such tumors and compared their wireless phone use.

…People who reported using wireless phones for 20 to 25 years were nearly twice as likely to be diagnosed with glioma as those who reported using them for less than a year, the study found. Those who used cell and cordless phones for more than 25 years were three times more likely to develop one of these tumors.

..The study did not show an association of wireless phones with malignant brain tumors other than glioma.

..Participants who recalled talking the most – more than 1,486 hours – on wireless phones were twice as likely to develop glioma compared to those who said they used the devices the fewest hours – between one and 122 hours, the study found.

..A World Health Organization panel of 31 scientists from 14 countries classified mobile phones as “possibly carcinogenic” in 2011. The U.S. Federal Communications Commission is currently reassessing the safe radiation exposure limits it adopted in 1996.

Children may be most vulnerable to wireless phone emissions, Hardell said. They absorb more radiofrequency electromagnetic fields, he writes, because of their small heads, thinner skulls and higher brain conductivity.

Source; http://www.reuters.com/article/2014/11/11/us-brain-cancer-mobilephone-idUSKCN0IV26Y20141111

Hardell concludes that this study justifes an upgrading of the WHO cancer risk to category one from present category 2B because of the strength of the evidence.

Reference Pathophysiology, online October 28, 2014.

Comment by PSRAST

Professor Hardell is renowned for his carefully designed studies of highest possible scientific quality. Differently from the common corporate-funded bogus studies, like the Interphone Study, he has carefully taken into account the time of exposure which is of decisive importance.

This valuable study, along with all the evidence from other approaches to safety analysis, see “Cellphone hazards proven beyond doubt” adds further reasons to assign the highest level of risk to mobile phone radiation according to the classification of WHO.

Here is a copy of Dr Hardells blog posting about this report:

New study confirms increased risk for glioma associated with use of mobile phones and cordless phones

We published recently a pooled analysis of our case-control studies on glioma and use of mobile phones and cordless phones. The study has been published in Pathophysiology after pre-review and can be accessed via Internet. The results confirm a statistically significant increased risk for glioma and the risk increases with time from first use of the wireless phone and number of hours for use over the years. The risk is highest on the same side of the brain as the phone has been used, especially in the area with the highest exposure to microwaves, the temporal lobe, which would be expected.

These studies strengthen the 2011 classification by IARC at WHO that the microwave exposure is a ‘Possible human carcinogen’, Group 2B. In fact using the Hill viewpoints on association and causation it should be classified as Group 1, the agent causes human cancer. We have explored that fact in more detail in a previous article. Cellphone hazards proven beyond doubt

2013/12/19 17:44 / Leave a comment

The total body of observations indicating harmful effects of cellphone usage has a strong evidential power.

The following elements are necessary for conclusive scientific proof of a harmful effect of any kind:

  • That it can be theoretically explained how the damage occurs.
  • That different measurement or analysis methods have confirmed the harmful effect experimentally.
  • That the harmful effect has been confirmed by different groups of scientists

These criteria are amply fulfilled in the case of cellphone radiation = microwave radiation as shown in this blog:

  • It has been theoretically predicted that microwave radiation generates free radicals that damage tissues
  • Different measurement methods have confirmed that microwave radiation generates free radicals in the tissues
  • It has been established by a very large body of experimental studies,  beyond any reasonable doubt, that microwave radiation damage tissues including DNA damage causing cancer, birth defects and childhood cancer. This is an established truth that all scientists agree about.
  • The predicted DNA damage has been amply confirmed at exposure to microwave radiation at intensity levels occurring in ordinary cellphone use.

Epidemiological data have weak, if any evidential value because of fundamental weaknesses in the method. Therefore, epidemiological studies reporting no harmful effect cannot be assigned any important significance in the risk assessment, especially as they are contradicted by the above mentioned evidence, see ”Mobile phone risks are considerably underestimated”.

It can be concluded beyond any doubt that microwave radiation from mobile phones increases the brain tumor risk, and in addition causes other serious consequences of radiation damage including childhood cancer and birth defects.

Moreover an increase of free radicals are associated with serious chronic diseases, including coronary artery disease and Atherosclerosis, Hypertension, Asthma, Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disorder (emphysema), Alzheimer, Parkinson, Anxiety disorders, Depression, Chronic Fatigue disorder, Diabetes complications  and many others (see for example “Oxydative stress in disease“).

Denial of cellphone hazards is unscientific and dishonest

Against the background of the above presented facts, it is uhjustified to deny harmful effects of mobile phone radiation. Only researchers who have a very narrow perspective, and thus are incompetent to assess the mobile phone risks, or are corrupt, can do so. Unfortunately such scientists have obviously dominated the expert bodies assessing the mobile phone radiation risks (see for example “WHO expert found to be mobile phone lobbyist“).

Cellphone radiation caused oxidative stress and impaired cognitive function

2013/12/19 15:54 / Leave a comment

Effect of low level microwave radiation exposure on cognitive function and oxidative stress in rats

[Abstract]
Use of wireless communicating devices is increasing at an exponential rate in present time and is raising serious concerns about possible adverse effects of microwave (MW) radiation emitted from these devices on human health.

The present study aimed to evaluate the effects of 900 MHz MW radiation exposure on cognitive function and oxidative stress in blood of Fischer rats. Animals were divided into two groups (6 animals/group): Group I (MW-exposed) and Group II (Sham-exposed). Animals were subjected to MW exposure (Frequency 900 MHz; specific absorption rate 8.4738 × 10-5 W/kg) in Gigahertz transverse electromagnetic cell (GTEM) for 30 days (2 h/day, 5 days/week).

Subsequently, cognitive function and oxidative stress parameters were examined for each group. Results showed significant impairment in cognitive function and increase in oxidative stress, as evidenced by the increase in levels of MDA (a marker of lipid peroxidation) and protein carbonyl (a marker of protein oxidation) and unaltered GSH content in blood.

Thus, the study demonstrated that low level MW radiation had significant effect on cognitive function and was also capable of leading to oxidative stress.

Source: Deshmukh et al. 2013. Effect of low level microwave radiation exposure on cognitive function and oxidative stress in rats Indian Journal of Biochemistry & Biophysics, 13 Dec 2013

Comment

Increased oxidative stress, that is, formation of tissue-damaging free radicals to a harmful extent, is a well-known effect of high-energy electromagnetic radiation. This study confirms, not very surprisingly, that cellphone radiation generates more free radicals in the tissues than what the body can neutralize.

Oxidative stress has been linked to increased cancer risk, Alzheimer, Parkinson and other serious chronic disorders.

The study also confirms other research indicating that cellphone radiation has a negative effect on cognitive functioning (that is thinking, reasoning, remembering).

It further underscores our conclusion that generous daily use of antioxidants (free radical scavengers) is likely to reduce the harmful impact of cellphone radiation.

We want to emphasize that generally, the officially recommended daily allowance for important antioxidants are generally far to low. For example, it is mostly 10-20 times too low for Vitamin C, which is an important antioxidant for the brain. It is non-toxic and can therefore be taken generously in gram-sized-doses, preferably in Slow-release tablets. The need is dependent on the health and stress level of the person and needs to be adapted individually. When ill, you may need tens of grams. Cellphone towers caused important health problems – new study reports

2013/12/18 18:48 / Leave a comment

Cellphone tower radiation could cause fatigue, memory loss, headache, cardiac diseases and congenital defects, according a study at the Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose Cancer Research Institute (NSCRI).
_
The scientists warn that the electromagnetic radiation that emanates 24 hours a day from cellphone towers might even cause cancer. 200 people living in areas with a high density of cellphone towers in central Kolkata were studied. They either had towers on the roof, or  within 50 metres of the towers. Almost everyone reported some kind of discomfort.
Some figures:

  • 70% of the residents reported increased fatigue;
  • 30% reported partial loss of memory;
  • 20% reported dizziness
  • 25% reported sleeping disorders.
  • 20% had skin infections,
  • 12-15% had hearing impairment
  • 10% had cardiac problems.
  • Almost 50% had difficulty in concentrating
  • 30% reported irritability.
  • Two babies –  had congenital defects, the study found.

The complaints were restricted to a 50-metre radius of the towers.

“Interestingly, most of the subjects of the study said the intensity of their ailments goes down once they leave their homes and reverts to the earlier stage once they return,” said Ashish Mukhopadhyay of NSCRI.Electromagnetic waves emitted from towers could cause cell damage, leading to cancer, Mukhopadhyay said. “Continued exposure to such waves could cause cell damage, leading to cancer. It could also trigger cardiac disorders,” he added.
